text.content:
When the Chat Commands setting is enabled, additional chat commands are made available. These commands can be entered directly into the chat window, starting with a forward slash (/).

Roll an Attack

Makes an attack roll with the specified modifier. The modifier can be written with or without the + symbol.

Command

/attack <modifier>

/a <modifier>

Example

/a +3

/a 5

Roll Damage

Rolls damage using the specified dice. You can optionally include a damage type or specify different damage types for individual dice using square brackets.

Command

/damage <dice> <(optional) type>

/d <dice> <(optional) type>

Example

/d 1d6

/d 2d6 poison

/d 2d10+8[piercing] + 2d6[fire]

Request a Concentration Saving Throw

Requests a concentration saving throw. The DC is optional.

Command

/concentration <(optional) dc>

/con <(optional) dc>

Example

/con

/con 10

Request a Saving Throw

Requests a saving throw. You can use either the full ability name (e.g., dexterity) or its shorthand (e.g., dex). The DC is optional.

Command

/save <ability> <(optional) dc>

/s <ability> <(optional) dc>

Example

/save strength

/s str

/s dex 10

Request a Skill Check

Requests a skill check. You can use either the full skill and ability names (e.g. athletics, strength) or their shorthand versions (e.g., ath, str). The ability and DC is optional. Excluding the ability will use the skill's default ability.

Command

/check <skill> <(optional) ability> <skill> <(optional) dc>

/c <skill> <(optional) ability> <(optional) dc>

/skill <skill> <(optional) ability> <(optional) dc>

/k <skill> <(optional) ability> <(optional) dc>

Example

/check athletics

/c ath

/c intimidation charisma 15

/c itm cha 15
